--- title: "Posit Team Dedicated" subtitle: | The convenience of SaaS
The governance & control of self-hosted title-slide-attributes: data-background-color: white data-background-image: _extensions/jthomasmock/positslides/assets/backgrounds/sample-title-slide-option-3.png data-background-size: contain format: positslides-revealjs: width: "1600" height: "900" progress: false history: true chalkboard: true transition: fade navigation: grid slide-tone: true slide-number: c/t # logo: _extensions/jthomasmock/positslides/posit-logo-fullcolor-TM.svg navigation-mode: vertical scrollable: true theme: local.scss format: drop: engine: pyodide --- # {background-image="_extensions/jthomasmock/positslides/assets/backgrounds/30-70-dark.png" background-size="contain" }

current state



:::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="35%"}   ::: ::: {.column width="65%"} - Any current IT workload challenges? - What internal SLOs do you deliver today? - How do you manage GRC today? - What jurisdictions do you need to operate in? - Do you need access to on-prem hardware? - Which cloud, which SSO? ::: :::: # {background-image="_extensions/jthomasmock/positslides/assets/backgrounds/30-70-dark.png" background-size="contain"}

Single-tenant SaaS



:::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="35%"}   ::: ::: {.column width="65%"} - Take the best of SaaS and self-hosted worlds - Not a generic managed service provider - Direct input from product teams - Expertise from Solutions Engineering and Product Development > Avoid the outsourced IT model, want the clarity of shared responsibility model. ::: :::: #    Posit Team concepts {background-image="_extensions/jthomasmock/positslides/assets/backgrounds/toc-light.png" background-size="contain"} ![](posit_team_overview.png) #    account architecture {background-image="_extensions/jthomasmock/positslides/assets/backgrounds/toc-light.png" background-size="contain"} :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="35%"} - Posit operators can only access workload accounts from a cloud-based secure operations center - Posit does not have access to existing data plane accounts - Both Posit and customer have access to workload account - Workload account contains both acceptance and production environments ::: ::: {.column width="65%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} result <- system2( "../../.local/bin/d2", c("--layout=elk", "accounts.d2", "accounts.svg", "> /dev/null"), stdout = TRUE ) result <- system2( "../../.local/bin/d2", c("--layout=elk", "workload.d2", "workload.png", "> /dev/null"), stdout = TRUE ) knitr::include_graphics("accounts.svg") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](accounts.svg){fig-pos='H'} ::: ::: ::: :::: #    shared responsibility {background-image="_extensions/jthomasmock/positslides/assets/backgrounds/toc-light.png" background-size="contain"} ```{mermaid} journey section Posit Dedicated Operators Configure & provision infra: 5: Operator Monitor & maintain: 5: Operator Respond to alerts: 3: Operator Plan and test upgrades: 5: Operator section Shared Audit account activity: 5: Operator, IT Review and approve upgrades: 3: IT, Data Admin section Data Scientist Select packages: 5: Data Admin Develop projects: 5: Data Scientist Running sessions and jobs: 5: Data Scientist ``` # {background-image="_extensions/jthomasmock/positslides/assets/backgrounds/30-70-light.png" background-size="contain" visibility="hidden"}

When



:::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="35%"}   ::: ::: {.column width="65%"} ```{mermaid} timeline title Roadmap 2023Q4 : internal preview 2024Q1 : pilot customer 2024Q2 : additional SSO integrations and datastores ``` ::: :::: ::: {.notes} TODO notes about timeline ::: # Fin {.has-dark-background background-image="_extensions/jthomasmock/positslides/assets/backgrounds/dark-section-3.png" background-size="contain"} ::: {.notes} TODO figure out how to apply the dark background class to make the title text light on this slide :::
